displaytitle: Pedestrian waiting for streetcar in this quiet town where there have been recent Nazi outbreaks on the Polish border, Czechoslovakia
creditline: Museum purchase, Fowler McCormick, Class of 1921, Fund
markings:

Stamp in red ink, verso, upper left: LIFE PICTURE COLLECTION

inscribed:
Inscribed on verso, upper right: #731615

Inscribed in graphite on verso, center: Main street of | Mairis [?] Ostrava | where there have been | recent Nazi outbreaks | on Polish border. 

Inscribed in graphite on verso, center: Maravia [?]

Inscribed in blue on verso, lower center: #1958-B

Inscribe in blue ink on verso, lower right: x Czeckoslovakia - Cities - 

Inscribed in blue on verso, lower right: Ostrava 

Inscribed on verso, lower center: PF84153

displaymaker: Margaret Bourke-White, 1904–1971; born Bronx, NY; died Stamford, CT | for LIFE magazine
caption: Margaret Bourke-White (1904–1971; born Bronx, NY; died Stamford, CT), for LIFE magazine, Pedestrian waiting for streetcar in this quiet town where there have been recent Nazi outbreaks on the Polish border, Czechoslovakia, 1937. Gelatin silver print; 24 × 18.2 cm (image), 24.3 × 18.4 cm (sheet). Museum purchase, Fowler McCormick, Class of 1921, Fund (2018-30)
